criteria.A: Five (or more) of the following symptoms during the same 2-week period and represent a change from previous functioning; at least one symptom is either (1) depressed mood or (2) loss of interest or pleasure
symptoms: Depressed mood most of the day, nearly every day
Markedly diminished interest or pleasure in all, or almost all, activities
Significant weight loss when not dieting or weight gain, or decrease/increase in appetite
Insomnia or hypersomnia nearly every day
Psychomotor agitation or retardation nearly every day
Fatigue or loss of energy nearly every day
Feelings of worthlessness or excessive or inappropriate guilt
Diminished ability to think or concentrate, or indecisiveness
Recurrent thoughts of death, recurrent suicidal ideation, or suicide attempt
criteria.B: Symptoms cause clinically significant distress or impairment
criteria.C: Episode is not attributable to physiological effects of substance or medical condition

criteria.A: Depressed mood for most of the day, for more days than not, for at least 2 years
criteria.B: Presence of two or more of the following symptoms
symptoms: Poor appetite or overeating
Insomnia or hypersomnia
Low energy or fatigue
Low self-esteem
Poor concentration or difficulty making decisions
Feelings of hopelessness

criteria.A: Excessive anxiety and worry occurring more days than not for at least 6 months
criteria.B: Individual finds it difficult to control the worry
criteria.C: Anxiety and worry are associated with three or more of the following symptoms
symptoms: Restlessness or feeling keyed up or on edge
Being easily fatigued
Difficulty concentrating or mind going blank
Irritability
Muscle tension
Sleep disturbance (difficulty falling or staying asleep, restless sleep)

criteria.A: Recurrent unexpected panic attacks defined as abrupt surge of intense fear/discomfort
symptoms: Palpitations, pounding heart, or accelerated heart rate
Sweating
Trembling or shaking
Sensations of shortness of breath or smothering
Feelings of choking
Chest pain or discomfort
Nausea or abdominal distress
Feeling dizzy, unsteady, light-headed, or faint
Chills or heat sensations
Paresthesias (numbness or tingling)
Derealization or depersonalization
Fear of losing control or going crazy
Fear of dying
criteria.B: At least one attack followed by 1 month of persistent concern or maladaptive change

social_anxiety_disorder.name: Social Anxiety Disorder (Social Phobia)
social_anxiety_disorder.name_zh: 社交焦慮症（社交恐懼症）

criteria.A: Marked fear or anxiety about one or more social situations
criteria.B: Individual fears acting in a way that will be negatively evaluated
criteria.C: Social situations almost always provoke fear or anxiety
criteria.D: Social situations are avoided or endured with intense fear
criteria.E: Fear is out of proportion to actual threat

criteria.A: Marked fear or anxiety about a specific object or situation
criteria.B: Phobic object or situation almost always provokes immediate fear
criteria.C: Phobic object or situation is actively avoided or endured with intense fear
criteria.D: Fear is out of proportion to actual danger
criteria.E: Fear persists for 6 months or more

criteria.A: Marked fear or anxiety about two or more of the following situations
situations: Standing in line or being in a crowd
Being outside of the home alone
criteria.B: Individual fears these situations because escape might be difficult

criteria.A: Criteria have been met for at least one manic episode
criteria.manic_episode: Distinct period of abnormally and persistently elevated, expansive, or irritable mood and abnormally increased goal-directed activity or energy, lasting at least 1 week
symptoms: Inflated self-esteem or grandiosity
Decreased need for sleep (feels rested after only 3 hours)
More talkative than usual or pressure to keep talking
Flight of ideas or subjective experience of racing thoughts
Distractibility
Increase in goal-directed activity or psychomotor agitation
Excessive involvement in activities with high potential for painful consequences

criteria.A: Criteria have been met for at least one hypomanic episode and at least one major depressive episode
criteria.B: There has never been a manic episode
hypomanic_symptoms: Same symptoms as mania but less severe
Duration of at least 4 consecutive days
Unequivocal change in functioning that is uncharacteristic

adhd_combined.name: Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Combined Presentation
adhd_combined.name_zh: 注意力不足過動症，混合型

criteria.A: Persistent pattern of inattention and/or hyperactivity-impulsivity
criteria.inattention: Six or more symptoms of inattention for children up to age 16, or five or more for individuals 17 and older
criteria.hyperactivity: Six or more symptoms of hyperactivity-impulsivity for children up to age 16, or five or more for individuals 17 and older
inattention_symptoms: Fails to give close attention to details or makes careless mistakes
Has difficulty sustaining attention in tasks or play activities
Does not seem to listen when spoken to directly
Does not follow through on instructions and fails to finish work
Has difficulty organizing tasks and activities
Avoids tasks that require sustained mental effort
Loses things necessary for tasks or activities
Is easily distracted by extraneous stimuli
hyperactivity_symptoms: Fidgets with hands or feet or squirms in seat
Leaves seat when remaining seated is expected
Runs about or climbs when inappropriate
Unable to play or engage in leisure activities quietly
Is on the go or acts as if driven by a motor
Blurts out answers before questions completed

ptsd.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
ptsd.category_zh: 創傷及壓力相關障礙症

criteria.A: Exposure to actual or threatened death, serious injury, or sexual violence
criteria.B: Presence of one or more intrusion symptoms
criteria.C: Persistent avoidance of stimuli associated with trauma
criteria.D: Negative alterations in cognitions and mood
criteria.E: Marked alterations in arousal and reactivity
intrusion_symptoms: Recurrent, involuntary, and intrusive distressing memories
Recurrent distressing dreams related to trauma
Intense or prolonged psychological distress at trauma cues
Marked physiological reactions to trauma reminders
avoidance_symptoms: Avoidance of trauma-related thoughts, feelings, or memories
Avoidance of external reminders of trauma
negative_mood_symptoms: Inability to remember important aspects of trauma
Persistent negative beliefs about oneself or world
Persistent inability to experience positive emotions

criteria.A: Presence of obsessions, compulsions, or both
obsessions: Recurrent and persistent thoughts, urges, or images experienced as intrusive and unwanted
Individual attempts to ignore or suppress thoughts or neutralize with another thought or action
compulsions: Repetitive behaviors or mental acts individual feels driven to perform
Behaviors aimed at preventing or reducing anxiety or preventing dreaded event
criteria.B: Obsessions or compulsions are time-consuming or cause significant distress

illness_anxiety_disorder.name: Illness Anxiety Disorder
illness_anxiety_disorder.category_zh: 身體症狀及相關障礙症

criteria.A: Preoccupation with having or acquiring a serious illness
criteria.B: Somatic symptoms are not present or, if present, are only mild in intensity
criteria.C: High level of anxiety about health, and individual is easily alarmed about personal health status
criteria.D: Individual performs excessive health-related behaviors or exhibits maladaptive avoidance

somatic_symptom_disorder.name: Somatic Symptom Disorder
somatic_symptom_disorder.category_zh: 身體症狀及相關障礙症

criteria.A: One or more somatic symptoms that are distressing or result in significant disruption of daily life
criteria.B: Excessive thoughts, feelings, or behaviors related to the somatic symptoms or associated health concerns
symptoms: Disproportionate and persistent thoughts about the seriousness of symptoms
Persistently high level of anxiety about health or symptoms
Excessive time and energy devoted to symptoms or health concerns

criteria.A: Restriction of energy intake leading to significantly low body weight
criteria.B: Intense fear of gaining weight or becoming fat, or persistent behavior that interferes with weight gain
criteria.C: Disturbance in the way in which one's body weight or shape is experienced

criteria.A: Recurrent episodes of binge eating characterized by eating large amounts of food and sense of lack of control
criteria.B: Recurrent inappropriate compensatory behaviors to prevent weight gain
criteria.C: Binge eating and compensatory behaviors occur at least once a week for 3 months
criteria.D: Self-evaluation is unduly influenced by body shape and weight

criteria.B: Binge-eating episodes are associated with three or more of the following
symptoms: Eating much more rapidly than normal
Eating until feeling uncomfortably full
Eating large amounts when not physically hungry
Eating alone because of embarrassment
Feeling disgusted, depressed, or guilty after overeating
criteria.D: Occurs at least once a week for 3 months

substance_use_disorder_alcohol.name: Alcohol Use Disorder
substance_use_disorder_alcohol.category_zh: 物質相關及成癮障礙症

criteria.A: Problematic pattern of alcohol use leading to clinically significant impairment or distress
symptoms: Alcohol taken in larger amounts or longer period than intended
Persistent desire or unsuccessful efforts to cut down or control alcohol use
Great deal of time spent obtaining, using, or recovering from alcohol
Craving or strong desire to use alcohol
Recurrent alcohol use resulting in failure to fulfill major role obligations
Continued alcohol use despite persistent social or interpersonal problems
Important activities given up or reduced because of alcohol use
Recurrent alcohol use in physically hazardous situations
Continued alcohol use despite knowledge of physical or psychological problems
Tolerance
Withdrawal

criteria.A: Predominant complaint of dissatisfaction with sleep quantity or quality
symptoms: Difficulty initiating sleep
Difficulty maintaining sleep
Early-morning awakening with inability to return to sleep
criteria.B: Sleep disturbance causes clinically significant distress or impairment
criteria.C: Sleep difficulty occurs at least 3 nights per week for at least 3 months
